page.title: 03ECOLOGY..WILDLIFE BATS
page.content: Concern has been expressed about the decline in number of bats in our local area and throughout North East Fife District . Dr.Bullock,a lecturer in the Zoology Department at St.Andrews University has formed the Fife Bat Group. The aim of the Bat Group is to study the movement and survival of bats and advise householders and landowners on ways to protect them. Dr.Bullock explained,"Interest in bats has been intensified as a result of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981. Our main aim is to reassure house owners that bats are intelligent, furry, flying mammals who should be regarded as guests not pests."
